TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit AnnotationResource extends System.Object implements class System.ComponentModel.INotifyPropertyChanged, class System.Xml.Serialization.IXmlSerializable

Docs.summary: Represents a content anchor or cargo resource for an .

remarks.format:
## Remarks AnnotationResource elements are used to model <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.Annotation.Anchors%2A> (the data that is being annotated) and <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.Annotation.Cargos%2A> (the data provided by the user such as a text note) in an <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.Annotation>.
Through the use of <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationResource.ContentLocators%2A> an AnnotationResource can refer to the content, directly contain the content, or both.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: This constructor supports the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_wpf](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-wpf-md.md)] infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This constructor is intended for annotation serializer use only. For application needs, use the <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationResource.%23ctor%2A> constructor that accepts a specified `name` parameter.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(valuetype System.Guid id) cil managed

Docs.summary: This constructor supports the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_wpf](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-wpf-md.md)] infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This constructor is intended for annotation serializer use only. For application needs, use the <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationResource.%23ctor%2A> constructor that accepts a specified `name` parameter.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string name) cil managed

Docs.param: A name to identify this resource from other <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.Annotation.Anchors%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.Annotation.Cargos%2A> defined in the same annotation.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a specified name.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The `name` parameter is provided for convenience only and no validation is performed on the string.
The AnnotationResource constructor automatically creates a unique [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_guid](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] that is accessible through the <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationResource.Id%2A> property.

Docs.summary: Gets the collection of elements contained in this resource.
Docs.value: The collection of content locators contained in this resource.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The ContentLocators property will never return `null`, however the collection may be empty if the resource contains no content locators.

Docs.summary: Gets a collection of the objects that define the content of this resource.
Docs.value: The collection of the objects that define the content of this resource.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Contents never returns `null`; however the <xref:System.Xml.XmlElement> collection may be empty if the resource contains no content.

Docs.summary: Always returns . See [Annotations Schema](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md) for schema details.
Docs.returns: Always . See [Annotations Schema](../Topic/Annotations%20Schema.md) for schema details.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a name for this .
Docs.value: The name assigned to this to distinguish it from other <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.Annotation.Anchors%2A> or <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.Annotation.Cargos%2A> in the annotation.
